MUHL-794A.description: Credit on acceptance of dissertation. Graded IP/CR/NC.

MUHL-794B.title: Doctoral Dissertation
MUHL-794B.description: Credit on acceptance of dissertation. Graded IP/CR/NC.

MUHL-794C.title: Doctoral Dissertation
MUHL-794C.description: Credit on acceptance of dissertation. Graded IP/CR/NC.

MUHL-794D.title: Doctoral Dissertation
MUHL-794D.description: Credit on acceptance of dissertation. Graded IP/CR/NC.

MUHL-794Z.title: Doctoral Dissertation
MUHL-794Z.description: Credit on acceptance of dissertation. Graded IP/CR/NC.

MUIN-270.title: Introduction to the Music Industry
MUIN-270.description: A survey of the music business with emphasis on distribution of recorded music, music publishing, performance rights societies, record companies, agents, personal managers and contracts. Open to music majors (B.M. and B.S. degrees) only.

MUIN-275A.title: Recording Arts Workshop
MUIN-275A.description: Principles, techniques, and aesthetic possibilities of the recording studio chain and its application to various media. Open to recording arts and music industry majors only.

MUIN-275B.title: Recording Arts Workshop
MUIN-275B.description: Principles, techniques, and aesthetic possibilities of the recording studio chain and its application to various media. Open to recording arts and music industry majors only.

MUIN-277.title: Introduction to Music Technology
MUIN-277.description: A survey of the technology used to create, prepare, perform, and distribute music, with an emphasis on recording, MIDI, music production, mastering and internet technologies. Not available for major credit to B.M. and B.S., Music Industry majors.

MUIN-280.title: Communications in the Music Industry
MUIN-280.description: A survey of the music industry communications including radio, television, film, satellite communications, records, compact disc, cassette, cable and any future forms of transmission and delivery systems.

synonyms: The Business and Economics of the Recording Industry
MUIN-287.title: The Business and Economics of the Recording Industry
MUIN-287.description: Economic considerations of home, studio and location recording. Equipment, labor, facilities, media, legal and tax considerations will be explored.

MUIN-305.title: MIDI and Computer Music Production
MUIN-305.description: Recording and editing MIDI and digital audio using computer software. Modern MIDI sequencing techniques for the music, film and television industries. Recommended preparation: MUIN 270, MUIN 275b, MUIN 280

MUIN-340.title: Introduction to Sound Reinforcement
MUIN-340.description: An introduction to the practical application of large scale sound reinforcement for concerts, sporting events, church services and convention situtations.

MUIN-360.title: Introduction to Music Law
MUIN-360.description: A study of entertainment law with a focus on the music industry. Areas of study include contracts, domestic practices, international practices, copyright protection, trademarks.

synonyms: Distribution of Recorded Music and Music Publishing
MUIN-370.title: Distribution of Recorded Music and Music Publishing
MUIN-370.description: A survey of various methods used to distribute music to the public. Recording distribution, manufacturing, retail outlets, accounting, publishing and performance rights.

synonyms: The Business and Legal Aspects of the Music Industry
MUIN-372B.title: The Business and Legal Aspects of the Music Industry
MUIN-372B.description: A survey of the major elements that support the music industry. History, copyright, music contracts, radio, record companies, managers, music publishing and communication. Not for major credit to B.M. and B.S., Music Industry majors.

MUIN-389.title: Digital Equipment and Recording
MUIN-389.description: Digital equipment including computers, sequencers, digital signal synthesis, MIDI, and rotary and stationary digital recording.

MUIN-392A.title: Acoustics and Speaker Design
MUIN-392A.description: Principles of acoustics relating to studio construction, wall treatment, and furnishings; natural reverberation, speaker materials, passive and active crossovers and time alignment.

MUIN-430.title: Artist Management and Development
MUIN-430.description: A study of issues relating to the personal management of music artists including negotiating contracts, image, career development, agents, touring, merchandizing, fees and duties.

synonyms: Manufacture and Distribution of Musical Products
MUIN-435.title: Manufacture and Distribution of Musical Products
MUIN-435.description: An in-depth study of musical instrument manufacture and distribution in the United States. Topics covered include sheet music, instruments rentals, lessons and band operations.

MUIN-442.title: Operation of the Radio Studio
MUIN-442.description: An in-depth study of radio studio technical operations. Topics include consoles, microphones, transmission considerations, networks, satellites, and digital and analog production situations.

MUIN-446A.title: Computer Assisted Recording and Editing
MUIN-446A.description: Techniques and applications of recording and editing sound on personal computers. Hardware, software, editing for song, sound effects and dialog for film.

MUIN-446B.title: Computer Assisted Recording and Editing
MUIN-446B.description: Techniques and applications of recording and editing sound on personal computers. Hardware, software, editing for song, sound effects and dialog for film.

MUIN-448.title: Computer Music Notation and Preparation
MUIN-448.description: Techniques and principles of computer music notation including conventions of music notation, idiomatic practices, preparation of significant score types, and MIDI basics.

MUIN-450.title: Practicum in Music Industry Issues (Internship)
MUIN-450.description: Field application of music industry theories and practices; part-time employment. Project jointly defined by student, employer and professor. Junior or Senior standing. Graded CR/NC.

MUIN-477.title: Remote Recording Techniques
MUIN-477.description: Special problems of location recording; specialized equipment; microphone design and operation.

MUIN-478.title: Advanced Multichannel Remix
MUIN-478.description: Special problems of multi-channel re-mixing with simultaneous audio re-processing. Album, film, television and multimedia formats will be covered.

MUIN-479.title: Audio Mastering
MUIN-479.description: A survey of the final creative steps of an audio CD. Concepts of acoustics, mastering suite design, critical listening, frequency, dynamics and sequencing. Recommended preparation: MUIN 360 or MUIN 372bx

MUIN-490.title: Directed Research
MUIN-490.description: Individual research and readings. Not available for graduate credit.

synonyms: Music Industry, Broadcast and the Internet
MUIN-495.title: Music Industry, Broadcast and the Internet
MUIN-495.description: An exploration of the effects of new technologies, laws, economic models, media (Internet, mobile, satellite), the decline of traditional broadcasting, and convergence with the music industry. Recommended preparation: MUIN 360 or MUIN 372bx

MUIN-496.title: Music Media Solutions
MUIN-496.description: Group study of one current music media issue, focusing on possible solutions with practical applications. Stress on leadership, critical thinking, and professional practices. By application only. Open to juniors and seniors only.

MUIN-498.title: Final Project
MUIN-498.description: Required for students who are working on recording projects. Booking of studios, weekly review of projects and advice on procedures and progress.

MUIN-570.title: The Music Industry
MUIN-570.description: A graduate level survey of the music business with emphasis on distribution of recorded music, music publishing, performance rights societies, musical products and live music.

MUIN-590.title: Directed Research
MUIN-590.description: Research leading to the Master's Degree. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department. Graded CR/NC.

MUIN-790.title: Research
MUIN-790.description: Research leading to the doctorate. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determinedd by the department. Graded CR/NC.

synonyms: Jazz: A History of America's Music
MUJZ-100.title: Jazz: A History of America's Music
MUJZ-100.description: Gateway to the minor in Jazz Studies. Historical evolution of jazz from its origins to present day; elements of musical structures and jazz styles revealed through the study of recorded examples, live performances and video. Not available for credit to jazz studies majors.

MUJZ-105B.title: Jazz Theory
MUJZ-105B.description: Study of basic and advanced concepts of jazz melody, harmony and form. Includes functional chord idioms and relationships, compositional and improvisational devices, and song forms.

synonyms: Basic Keyboard Skills for the Improviser
MUJZ-141B.title: Basic Keyboard Skills for the Improviser
MUJZ-141B.description: Reading skills related to jazz accompanying, including the ability to identify and play chords on the piano utilizing different voicings.

MUJZ-142B.title: Jazz Ear Training
MUJZ-142B.description: Sight-singing and melodic/rhythmic reading and dictation applied to jazz repertoire. Includes vocalization of scales and chord patterns and study of rhythmic reading and jazz articulation.

MUJZ-150.title: Beginning Jazz Improvisation
MUJZ-150.description: Development of beginning improvisational skills, including modal and the ii-V7-I chord progression, through instrumental performance. Recommended to non-jazz majors. Not available for credit to Jazz Studies majors. Recommended preparation: demonstration of major scales of eight notes at a tempo of 120 mm

MUJZ-195.title: Jazz Elements I
MUJZ-195.description: Study of compositional, improvisational, performance, and arranging elements found in jazz. Students will model influential groups and jazz artists.

MUJZ-196.title: Jazz Combo I
MUJZ-196.description: Rehearsal and performance of literature for jazz chamber groups. Graded CR/NC. (Duplicates credit in MUEN 332.)

MUJZ-218B.title: Afro-Latin Percussion Instruments
MUJZ-218B.description: Instruction in the performance of percussion instruments associated with African, South American, and Caribbean music traditions, with special emphasis on adaptation to jazz music.

MUJZ-252.title: Individual Instrument Performance Class I
MUJZ-252.description: Solo and orchestra repertoire, professional preparation, reed making, and other matters appropriate to group study. Required of all first and second year wind and percussion majors each semester in residence.

MUJZ-300.title: Non-Major Individual Instruction
MUJZ-300.description: Intermediate and advanced instruction designed for non-music majors. Not available for credit to music majors.

MUJZ-301.title: Individual Instruction
MUJZ-301.description: Intermediate and advanced instruction on secondary instrument for music majors, on principal instrument for music minors and B.S. music majors. Open only to music majors and minors.

MUJZ-400.title: Arranging for Jazz Ensemble
MUJZ-400.description: Scoring for jazz ensemble with emphasis on writing for sections of like and mixed instruments as well as full ensemble.

synonyms: The Jazz Experience: Myths and Culture
MUJZ-419.title: The Jazz Experience: Myths and Culture
MUJZ-419.description: An examination of the music, culture, and mythology of jazz revealed through the study of jazz fiction, film, poetry, and recorded examples.

MUJZ-443.title: Jazz Pedagogy
MUJZ-443.description: Concepts, methods, and resources; examination and comparison of textbooks, recordings, tapes, and materials related to the study and teaching of jazz.

MUJZ-451.title: Advanced Jazz Improvisation
MUJZ-451.description: Development of advanced improvisational skills including Lydian- chromatic and Bi-modal techniques, through instrumental performance. Junior standing.

MUJZ-452.title: Individual Instrument Performance Class II
MUJZ-452.description: Solo and orchestra repertoire, professional preparation, reed making, and other matters appropriate to group study. Required of all third and fourth year wind and percussion majors each semester in residence.

synonyms: Jazz Masters from WWII to the Present
MUJZ-486.title: Jazz Masters from WWII to the Present
MUJZ-486.description: Examination of major jazz artists from WWII to the present with emphasis on the innovators of each period. Detailed analysis of selected repertoire. Recommended preparation: MUJZ 419.

MUJZ-490.title: Directed Research
MUJZ-490.description: Individual research and readings. NOT AVAILABLE FOR GRADUATE CREDIT.

MUJZ-501.title: Individual Instruction
MUJZ-501.description: Secondary instruction for graduate music majors or instruction for graduate non-music majors.

MUJZ-545.title: Jazz Ensemble Development
MUJZ-545.description: Techniques, approaches, teaching materials, and music useful in developing jazz ensembles in educational settings, from junior high school through college.

MUJZ-551.title: Graduate Jazz Improvisation
MUJZ-551.description: Development of proficiency in improvising to advanced jazz concepts, including transposition, substitute harmony, superimposed harmony, atypical harmonic schemes, and contemporary chord and scale types. Open to jazz studies majors and studio guitar majors.

MUJZ-554.title: Graduate Certificate Performance
MUJZ-554.description: Individual instruction and related lab participation for Graduate Certificate students.

MUJZ-590.title: Directed Research
MUJZ-590.description: Research leading to the Master's Degree. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department. Graded CR/NC.

MUJZ-653.title: Performance
MUJZ-653.description: Individual or master class instruction for D.M.A. Performance majors.

MUJZ-790.title: Research
MUJZ-790.description: Research leading to the doctorate. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department. Graded CR/NC.

MPKS-150A.title: Beginning Piano
MPKS-150A.description: Techniques of performance, note reading, and basic musicianship. Not open to music majors.

MPKS-150B.title: Beginning Piano
MPKS-150B.description: Techniques of performance, note reading, and basic musicianship. Not open to music majors.

MPKS-150C.title: Beginning Piano
MPKS-150C.description: Techniques of performance, note reading, and basic musicianship. Not open to music majors.

synonyms: Functional Skills for Keyboard Majors I
MPKS-160B.title: Functional Skills for Keyboard Majors I
MPKS-160B.description: Sight-reading and principles of style as related to intermediate literature; c- clef and open score reading; improvisation and functional harmony. Introduction to standard reference works, periodicals. Required of all keyboard majors.

synonyms: Introduction to Piano Repertoire and Performance
MPKS-170B.title: Introduction to Piano Repertoire and Performance
MPKS-170B.description: Survey of basic piano repertoire and styles through lecture, discussion, and performance. a: Late Baroque through Beethoven; b: Schubert to the present. Prerequisite: Piano performance major status or consent of instructor.

MPKS-228.title: Four-Hand Keyboard Repertoire
MPKS-228.description: Preparation and performance of literature for piano duets and duo-piano.

MPKS-250B.title: Keyboard Instruction I
MPKS-250B.description: Beginning and elementary instruction: emphasis on reading skills, harmonization, transposition, score reading, improvisation; group instruction in a keyboard laboratory facility.

synonyms: Functional Skills for Keyboard Majors II
MPKS-260B.title: Functional Skills for Keyboard Majors II
MPKS-260B.description: Sight- reading and principles of style as related to lower advanced literature; extended score reading; improvisation and functional harmony. Mini-survey; basic keyboard literature.

MPKS-300.title: Non-Major Individual Instruction
MPKS-300.description: Intermediate and advanced instruction designed for non-music majors. Not available for credit to music majors.

MPKS-301.title: Individual Instruction
MPKS-301.description: Intermediate and advanced instruction on secondary instrument for music majors, on principle instrument for music minors and B.A. music majors. Open only to music majors and minors.

MPKS-350B.title: Keyboard Instruction II
MPKS-350B.description: Intermediate and advanced instruction; development of reading, performance, and improvisation skills necessary for proficiency examinations. Group and individualized instruction in a keyboard laboratory facility.

MPKS-360B.title: Accompanying
MPKS-360B.description: Techniques of vocal and instrumental accompanying.

MPKS-431B.title: Piano Pedagogy: Introduction and Practicum
MPKS-431B.description: The learning process at the keyboard; pedagogy and methodology of beginning methods. Studio/group instruction: children/adults. 431a: survey and observation. 431b: practice teaching: beginners.

synonyms: Piano Pedagogy: Intermediate Literature and Functional Skills
MPKS-450B.title: Piano Pedagogy: Intermediate Literature and Functional Skills
MPKS-450B.description: Methods, study of college curriculum keyboard classes. Studio/group instruction. Business practices; audition, interview techniques. 450a: Survey and observation. 450b practice teaching; secondary piano classes.

MPKS-472B.title: Piano History and Literature
MPKS-472B.description: Solo piano literature; emphasis on composers' influences, performance practices and the development of the pianoforte. a: Late Baroque through Beethoven. b: Schubert to the present.

MPKS-481.title: Interpretation of Baroque Music
MPKS-481.description: Repertoire and performance practice in music of the period: style, phrasing, embellishments, dynamics, improvisation, tempi. Performance in class of solo and ensemble works, instrumental and vocal.

MPKS-490.title: Directed Research
MPKS-490.description: Individual research and readings. NOT AVAILABLE FOR GRADUATE CREDIT.

MPKS-501.title: Individual Instruction
MPKS-501.description: Secondary instruction for graduate music majors or instruction for graduate non-music majors.

synonyms: Special Studies in Solo Repertoire for Piano
MPKS-520.title: Special Studies in Solo Repertoire for Piano
MPKS-520.description: Historical, stylistic and pedagogical aspects of solo repertoire. Special emphasis to be determined by the department.

MPKS-554.title: Graduate Certificate Performance
MPKS-554.description: Individual instruction and related lab participation for Graduate Certificate students.

MPKS-560.title: Song Interpretation Master Class
MPKS-560.description: Performance masterclass for advanced singers and pianists.

MPKS-561.title: Chamber Music Interpretation Master Class
MPKS-561.description: Performance masterclass for advanced pianists and instrumentalists.

MPKS-590.title: Directed Research
MPKS-590.description: Research leading to the Master's Degree. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department. Graded CR/NC.

MPKS-653.title: Performance
MPKS-653.description: Individual or master class instruction for D.M.A. Performance majors.

MPKS-754.title: Artist Diploma Performance
MPKS-754.description: Individual instruction and related lab participation for Artist Diploma students.

MPKS-790.title: Research
MPKS-790.description: Research leading to the doctorate. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department. Graded CR/NC.
